title: Effect of an FXR1 mutation on gene expression

content.question: (a) Describe how amino acids are categorized by their chemical properties. Explain how a change in the amino acid sequence of the <math alttext="F X R 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FXR1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein could decrease the ability of the protein to bind to <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>RNA</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.

frqParts.text: (a) Describe how amino acids are categorized by their chemical properties. Explain how a change in the amino acid sequence of the <math alttext="F X R 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FXR1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein could decrease the ability of the protein to bind to <math alttext="R N A" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mtext>RNA</mtext> </mrow> </mstyle> </math>.

(b) Using the template in the space provided for your response, construct an appropriately labeled graph that represents the data shown in Table <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. Determine whether there is a statistical difference in the amount of <math alttext="F X R 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FXR1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein produced by the cells after <math alttext="16" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>16</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="24" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>24</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> hours in the presence of <math alttext="I L 19" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IL-19</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

(c) Based on the data for the <math alttext="48" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>48</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>-hour period, describe the effect of <math alttext="I L 19" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>IL-19</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> on <math alttext="F X R 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mi>X</mi><mi mathvariant="italic">R</mi><mtext mathvariant="italic">1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> gene expression.

(d) The researcher hypothesizes that the <math alttext="F X R 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi><mi>X</mi><mi mathvariant="italic">R</mi><mn mathvariant="italic">1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> gene codes for a protein that binds to <math alttext="m R N A’s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNAs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> that encode some of the proteins that damage arteries. Individuals with a particular mutation of the <math alttext="F X R 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>F</mi><mi>X</mi><mi>R</mi><mtext>1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> gene tend to have high levels of these proteins. Based on this information, predict how the <math alttext="F X R 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>FXR1</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> protein most likely interacts with the <math alttext="m R N A’s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>mRNAs</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.
